top of rice stem, rice already harvested
louse (on body / in clothes; NOT on head)

column3: cloth (still being woven in loom, not finished yet)
ghost, god (a "large" spirit - can possess people etc.)
mother's older sister or older brother's wife
to change, to exchange, to swap
to pull up (trouser legs, sleevesː pull all the way up)
to ascend, to climb, to get on (a bus)
to pass, to go by, to cross
to step into a hole or depression and fall, to trip
to lean on (one object resting against a fixed object)
to rest on (two objects leaning against each other)
to rest upon (e.g. a stick resting on two objects to hold it up)
to take a rest (for a short length of time)
to dig (a potato out of the ground)
to cut (grass with a sickle), to mow
to miss (someone), to worry about (sb. who is absent)
to bump into, to come across
to call (sb. over), to be called
to feel, touch, squeeze (to see if it's hard or soft)
to wear, to carry on one's body
to hold in one's mouth (e.g. a pipe)
to turn (the pages of a book)
to bend (in order to pick something up)
to cover (with a shade, e.g. covering many dishes to stop the flies getting at them)
to roast (meat sticks on a barbecue)
to warm (clothes in front of a fire order to dry them)
to wait, to greet, to welcome
to take (to take sth. to give to sb.)
to carry on a shoulder pole
to carry over one's shoulder or on one's arm, e.g. a backpack, a handbag, etc.
half (e.g. something long and straight cut into two; one of the halves)
the same (two objects are identical, e.g. two stools)
to be alike (e.g. he looks like his father)
